sources.data_found: 2022 Degrees Awarded in Computer & Information Sciences: 79 Bachelor's degrees, 253 Master's degrees, 6 Doctoral degrees.

student_data.notes: Official granular enrollment by major is not publicly listed on SMU's Registrar website. Counts are estimated based on IPEDS/DataUSA completion data for 'Computer & Information Sciences' (CIP 11.01). Undergrad estimated as 79 degrees awarded * 4 years = 316. Grad (MS) estimated as 253 degrees awarded * 1.5 year avg duration = ~380 (High number reflects SMU's large professional/online MS programs). PhD estimated as 6 degrees * 5.5 years = 33.

gpu_resources.notes:
Calculations: 
1) NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD: 20 DGX nodes * 8 GPUs/node = 160 A100 GPUs. (Categorized as 80GB based on 'SuperPOD' designation and late 2021 installation date). 
2) ManeFrame II (Accelerator Nodes): 36 nodes * 1 P100/node = 36 P100 GPUs. 
3) ManeFrame II (Standard/GPU Nodes): 5 nodes * 2 V100/node = 10 V100 GPUs. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: SMU has a very high GPU-to-student ratio due to the dedicated NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD (160 A100s) relative to a smaller private university student body. Student counts are derived from degree completion rates as direct 'enrollment by major' tables were not accessible without login.
